page.title: 05SETTLEMENT CHANGES cont
page.content:
1980's
Northbrook andecclesdon frams still survive although other single settlements have vanished. Woods have shrunk even further. However the main difference is that of the amalgamation of all the settlements into one massive housing area, except for the two squares in the north west.
WHY THE CHANGES TOOK PLACE l) {Growth of population}due to improved medical knowledge 2) {Population 'booms' in Worthing after both World Wars. Many council houses were built for the families of the soldiers who couldnot afford their own houses. The Maybridge Estate was built after the 2nd World War for this reason. Also {evacuees}returned to settle on the south coast.
